body.value:
DrupalCamp Atlanta is one of the southeast's largest annual Drupal conferences attracting hundreds of web developers, designers, executives and educators who are engaged with teaching and learning Drupal.

This conference is comprised of multiple concurrent sessions with tracks ranging from Beginner, Design/Theming and Usability, Development and Performance, Site Building, Business Leadership, and Education. In addition, there are impromptu birds of feather (BOF) sessions, code sprints all concluding with a networking reception. Located Buckhead neighborhood, which hosts some of the best startups, restaurants and the Lennox Mall. Now you can take the MARTA train straight from the airport.


Career Summit. Find the Best Drupal Talent


Are you looking to make a career change? Are you looking to hire your next employee? The DrupalCamp Atlanta Career Summit will bring together local leaders, students and job seekers to discuss the future of enterprise content management systems. Participants will learn how open source solves the most complex problems for organizations like Georgia Tech, Emory, Nasa, Nasdaq, and Ga.gov.


Learn More about the Summit

We hope to see you in Berkeley October 14th - 17th, 2020, for this year’s BADCamp!

For more than 13 years the Bay Area Drupal Camp has gathered thousands from a worldwide community of Drupal users, developers, marketers and content specialists to share their expertise, level up their skills, and make new friends in the intellectual and cultural heart of the Bay Area. Whether if it's your first time attending or your tenth, we look forward to seeing you in October!

Four days of training, summits, sessions, contributions, and socials!

Florida DrupalCamp is an annual conference that brings together web developers from all over the world to learn, network, collaborate, and discuss web development and the Drupal content management system.

This year, Florida DrupalCamp 2021 will be held Thursday, February 18th through Saturday, February 20th virtually. Thursday will be training. Friday will be a half day of sessions, and Saturday will be contribution sprints.

Drupal Camp Asheville is an annual two-day conference that focuses on hands-on training, community contribution and knowledge sharing for all levels of Drupal experience, and is now accepting the sessions submissions.

Drupal 8 and 9 Migrations by Example
Starting with Drupal 8, the Migrate API makes it possible to write and execute migrations without having to write PHP code. It is also possible to execute them from the Drupal administration interface if the command line is not available or you prefer not to use it.

This session will explain the Migrate API and many of its concepts like source, process, and destination plugins from a site builder perspective. Subfields, constants, pesude-fields, the process pipeline will also be explained. You will also learn about the migrate ecosystem to be aware of what tools are at your disposal. The examples include migrating from CSV and JSON files to populate different field types like taxonomy, date, image, file, and address.

=> Learning Objectives
* Learn to run migrations from the user interface.
* Understand different Migrate API concepts.
* Import data from CSV and JSON files.
* Transform the data to populate taxonomy, date, image, file, and address fields.

=> Target Audience
People who want to learn about the workflow and thought process to migrate data into Drupal 8/9. Site builders will learn how to perform migrations. Project managers will understand the complexity of these tasks for better estimation.
Prerequisites

Although no prior Migrate module knowledge is required, it is expected that attendees have a basic understanding of site building concepts like nodes, content types, and fields. You can have a look at this video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=02fvLzPSIjc for an overview of the Drupal site building concepts.

If you want a headstart, you can learn more about Drupal's Migrate API at https://understanddrupal.com/migrations

About the speaker:
Mauricio Dinarte is a Drupal and ReactJS developer with a decade of experience. He is passionate about teaching. In 2019, he started https://understanddrupal.com/ where they blog in English, Spanish, and French. Lately, Mauricio has focused on Drupal migrations and has produced content on the topic.

About the sponsor:
Kanopi Studios - They design, build, and support websites for clients who want to make a positive impact.

Where: On-Line!

Join us on slack: http://sfdrupal.herokuapp.com

SFDUG seeks to provide a friendly, safe environment. All participants should be able to engage in productive dialogue. They should share and learn with each other in an atmosphere of mutual respect. We require all participants adhere to the Drupal Code of Conduct. This applies to all community interaction and events.

Feature Presentation: Meetup Planning

Since we will not be doing a camp, we are organizing a monthly meetup online via Zoom. These will be one hour long between noon and 1 pm Central Time on the 2nd Thursday of the month. This meetup will replace the already established CIDUG meetup. The first one will be:

Thursday, June 11. Noon to 1 pm U.S. Central Time.

The first item for discussion will be what we want to do with these meetings. What topics do people want to hear about, and who is willing to present on them? We'll be sending out email notifications about this and future meetups here and via our DrupalCorn mailing list.

Feel free to leave comments or topic ideas in the comments.

About CIDUG Meetings

The first part is our feature presentation where someone presents a particular topic. After the presentation, the meeting changes to an open discussion/question time. If you have a question, learned something cool, or would like to bounce ideas around with others, please come and share!

MidCamp - the Midwest Drupal Camp - is the seventh annual conference held in Chicago that brings together people who use, develop, design, and support one of the web’s leading content management platforms, Drupal.

  • Thursday & Friday, March 19-20 — Virtual Sessions
  • Saturday, March 21 — Contribution Day (free)

MidCamp attendees come for three days of presentations, contribution sprints, and (virtual) socials while brushing (virtual) shoulders with Drupal service providers, hosting vendors, and other members of the broader web development community.

Whether you’re an existing Drupal user, developer, designer, site builder, or are maybe just a little Drupal-curious, you won’t want to miss out on this unique event. MidCamp offers attendees the opportunity to increase their Drupal knowledge through networking, contribution sprints, and more.

MidCamp is organized by a broad network volunteers from the regional Drupal community, making it a true showcase for Drupal in the Midwest. MidCamp attracts speakers and attendees from around the country and the world, making it more than just another local event.

Feature Presentation: Upgrading to Drupal 8/9 using the Migrate API

Mauricio Dinarte will provide an overview of the tools and processes to upgrade your Drupal 6/7 site to Drupal 8/9 using the Migrate API. We will use the automated upgrade procedure to get a head start in writing the migrations. We will explain how to change your site's information architecture as part of the upgrade process.

Thursday, July 9. Noon to 1 pm US Central Time.

Feel free to leave comments or topic ideas in the comments. The Zoom URL will be shared via the mailing list and the post on groups.drupal.org one day before the event.

About CIDUG Meetings

We'll be sending out notifications about this and future meetups here and via our DrupalCorn mailing list.

We meet on the 2nd Thursday of the month over the noon hour (US Central) via Zoom. There are two types of meetups: presentation and discussion. The meetup types alternate every month. Presentation meetups start with a presentation and are a maximum of 45 minutes in length. The rest of the hour is for open Q&A and discussion. Discussion meetups are like Birds of a Feather (BoF) where there may be a topic, but no formal agenda or presentation.

Sign up to present or lead a discussion.

list.title: DrupalCorn Meetup: Upgrading to Drupal 8/9 using the Migrate API

Leverage the power of Lando to quickly spin up a contribution environment, test or make patches, and tear it down to start over on a new issue or patch. Leverage Lando tooling to make these things as automatic and painless as possible.

4:30 Presentation: LLC, Corporation or Sole Prop/Partnership
In this 30-minute session, Gabe will outline the basic differences between the various business entity forms and the pluses and minuses of each, including touching on tax considerations and administrative burden. He'll also discuss the importance of certain provisions to include in agreements between business owners (i.e., partnership, operating and shareholder agreements).

body.value:
Drupal Flyover Camp is an event for technologists, designers, business leaders, and anyone who uses Drupal or supports Drupal in any capacity. We welcome you to join us for three days of networking, learning, and camaraderie in the heart of the Midwest. Or, as many refer to it, flyover country.

The two day virtual event will take place Thursday, Sep 17 - Friday, Sep 18, 2020. Online venue TBD, check our site for current news.

Join us on Friday, June 19 at 12:00-1:00 pm for our next Drupal Toronto "Lunch n' Learn" Virtual Meetup.

LOCATION: Web Conference
TIME: 12:00-1:00pm

The first weeks and months of the COVID-19 pandemic were a challenging time for all. The pandemic presented unique challenges for the Ontario Digital Service (ODS) as we were tasked with passing timely pandemic-related information along to the public: information about emergency orders, testing, benefits, taxes, business supports and more were all in high-demand and changing quickly, as was the growing list of stakeholders. The ODS decided to leverage our favourite CMS (Drupal) to help us meet these demands and we’ll go over some of what we did in this case-study.

A few of the topics you'll learn about:

* Development and product-management best-practices
* Drupal tools and utilities to help write code quickly and efficiently
* Contributed modules to leverage to allow contributors to work more effectively

PRESENTED BY

Nick Gajewski
Senior Developer & Tech Lead,
Ontario Digital Service

list.title: DrupalTO[Online] COVID-19.ontario.ca Leveraging Drupal in the Information Crisis

body.value:
Please do register through Meetup.com link to get the meeting link the day of event: https://www.meetup.com/drupalchicago/events/271322394/

**Deploy to Mars with Lando**

"You thought Lando was just a flight simulator. A tool to be used on the ground, safely replicating the real-world environment you and your team face in production. What if I told you that Lando is also your production facility, your launchpad, and your mission control? That it’s the launch vehicle that takes you to orbit as well as the ground-support system that sees your mission through to success?

If a mission to Mars could serve as the perfect metaphor for building, launching, and maintaining your Drupal project, then strap in as we head to another world using Lando. Not only will you see how Lando can quickly and easily simulate your production environment for all members of your team, but also how you can use it as a control console for your project and an autopilot to your workflow. We’ll spin up a local Drupal-as-an-app environment for sending static html to space using the Tome module. We’ll produce and deploy build artifacts to the red planet with a single local command. We’ll prevent rapid unscheduled disassembly of your deployment by automating testing. We’ll jettison Drupal’s front end and demonstrate working with decoupled environments. We’ll fire up Lando’s Hyperdrive script to automatically build your project in the cosmos. Whether you’re new to Lando or have extensive flight hours, be prepared for liftoff as we use terrible space puns to take you on a mission to Lando on another world."

**Presenter: Aaron Feledy**

Owner, Arrow One Solutions
Twitter: @aaronfeledy

**Host**
Zoom. Password will be sent to RSVP'ed attendees via MeetUp messages around 6:45pm.
Please message Dwayne directly through Meetup if you have issues.

**Schedule**
* 7:00 - 7:15pm CDT :: Socializing and Networking

list.title: Drupal Chicago July Meetup: Deploy to Mars with Lando

Welcome to DIA Virtual Conclave, an online Drupal event organized by the Drupal India Association as part of its ambitious goals of advocating and enabling the Indian Drupal Community towards becoming one of the top quality contributors of Drupal.

This event is focused around contribution excellence and Drupal 9, which got released on 3rd June 2020. Being the easiest major version upgrade in a decade, Drupal 9 has also got dramatically easier tools for the end-user. The Drupal community is excited about it and can't wait to explore, share, and learn more.

The event schedule is as follows :

3:30 PM IST - 4:00 PM IST The Journey of the ‘Drupal India Association’ by Rahul Dewan, Founder & Managing Director, Srijan
4:00 PM IST - 5:00 PM IST Keynote session on "Excellence with the new normal: Future of work, leadership & the role of technology" by Muktesh Kandpal, Country Manager & Sr. Director, India at Acquia
5:00 PM IST - 6:00 PM IST "State of Drupal 9" by Gábor Hojtsy, Drupal 9 Initiative Coordinator and Drupal Acceleration Team at Acquia
6:00 PM IST - 7:00 PM IST "A new grand compromise in content management" by Preston So, Sr. Director, Product Strategy at Oracle
7:00 PM IST - 8:00 PM IST Community Panel Discussion, Top contributors from Indian Community sharing their Contribution Stories
8:00 PM IST - 9:00 PM IST Closing Session on "Women in Open source" by Megan Sanicki, Manager, Research & Operations, Google Open Source Program Office

Registrations are open!

The only conference on the future of CMS, headlessCMS, and decoupledCMS.

In its forth year after a successful debut in 2017, Decoupled Days is a conference for architects, developers, and businesspeople involved in implementing decoupled CMS architectures. The 2020 edition is scheduled for July 22 - 23, 2020 as a virtual conference.

Decoupled architectures use a CMS (Drupal, WordPress, etc) as a content service for other non-CMS applications, whether they are in native desktop or mobile, universal JavaScript, set-top boxes, IoT devices, conversational interfaces, or other technologies.
All are welcome to join us for our monthly meetup. Please RSVP using the "Agenda and RSVP" button above.

Feature Presentation: Discussion Around Static Site Generation

We will have an open discussion around static site generation. The idea behind static site generation is to take content from a dynamic, database-driven system (like Drupal) and generating plain-old HTML files that then get deployed to the production site. There are some benefits and limitations to this. John Rearick will start the discussion off with a general overview (maybe 15minutes) and the rest of the hour will be open discussion asking questions and sharing what we have learned.

Thursday, August 13. Noon to 1 pm US Central Time.

Feel free to leave comments or topic ideas in the comments.

The Zoom URL will be shared via the mailing list and the post on groups.drupal.org one day before the event.

Discussion meetups are like Birds of a Feather (BoF) where there may be a topic, but no formal agenda or presentation.

Sign up to present or lead a discussion.

body.value:
Join us for DrupalCon European Edition !

Gathering the Drupal community in a safe and healthy environment is our main priority. The uncertainty gives us no other choice than going virtual in 2020, and renaming the event to DrupalCon Europe 2020. The dates of the conference remain the same, the event will be held between December 8-11 2020, online, in CET timezone.

With the format changes we are happy to introduce a few new opportunities to the conference, and we strongly believe that the community will contribute to a great experience of the virtual DrupalCon Europe 2020.

Wir freuen uns auf Teilnehmer*innen vieler Usergroups, z.B. aus Hamburg, Rostock, Berlin, Dresden, Hannover, Bochum, Köln, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Karlsruhe, Stuttgart, München oder Konstanz.

Für dieses Meetup nutzen wir wieder die Jitsi-Instanz des Drupal e.V.: https://meet.drupal.de/drupal-meetup-germany

Heute gibt es u.a. einen Vortrag von Kai Gertz zum Thema "Layout Paragraphs"

Ein paar Tipps dazu:

  • verwendet wenn möglich einen Chromium--basierten Browser (Chromium, MS Edge, Google Chrome, Vivaldi), Firefox ist bei WebRTC / Video leider problematisch
  • muted bitte euer Mikrofon, wenn Ihr den Raum betretet
  • das Betreten des Raums erzeugt eine hohe CPU-Last, also bitte nicht alle gleichzeitig Punkt 19 Uhr dazukommen
  • die Bilder vieler Teilnehmer*innen werden eingefroren sein. Das ist Absicht (Lastreduzierung)
  • vergebt beim Betreten des Raums einen Alias für euren Benutzer, damit wir euch besser erkennen können
  • nutzt den integrierten Chat in Jitsi für Infos und Fragen
  • falls Ihr Screenshots macht, informiert bitte die anderen Teilnehmer*innen vorher, damit diese ggf. ihre Kamera abschalten können (Datenschutz)

Das Online Drupal Meetup Germany bietet die Möglichkeit, sich bundesweit mit anderen Drupalistas zu treffen und auszutauschen. Jede Ausgabe wird dabei von einer anderen Usergroup betreut, welche das ist, wird beim Meetup besprochen, ebenso der nächste Termin. Themenvorschläge oder Vorträge kann dabei Jede*r einbringen!

Fragen, Wünsche oder Themenvorschläge? Schreibt einen Kommentar oder meldet euch unter https://drupalchat.me/ im Channel #drupal-meetup-germany.

Wir freuen uns auf interessante Beiträge - und auf Euch natürlich!

We are a group of Drupal enthusiasts who enjoy getting together the first Thursday of each month at 6pm to talk about Drupal, plan Drupal events, and have some fun. During TBDUG meetings we showcase modules, projects, and themes. Share your tips and tricks, and get your questions about Drupal answered!

Meetings are free if we buy food. Tell the cashier you are with the Drupal group. Please join us!

We often talk about websites the way we talk about cars. Are you driving a flashy sports car or a stable hatchback? And is yours a lemon, no matter how pretty the paint job? And if you just got one used, what’s going on under the hood? There’s a way to address these questions about your website, and it’s called a technical audit.

The vast majority of site owners live in fear of the day their site “breaks down.” Performing a site audit can ensure you understand the current state of your site, from the back end code level to the front end performance. It can also help you see potential problems when it comes time to add features (like that sweet audio system).

People attending this session will learn the basic building blocks of performing a technical audit.
- Approaches for auditing different aspects of your site: custom code, theme and front-end functionality, back-end configuration and modules, accessibility, etc.
- Tools that can be used to run these tests
- Tips on what to watch for when managing a website over time

Presenter: AmyJune Hineline

"AmyJune is an active contributor in the open-source world. She is the Community Ambassador and QA Engineer at Kanopi Studios.

Her ongoing experience as a hospice nurse keeps her in touch with the challenges faced by many end-users. In her continued efforts to make a difference, she helps organize A11yTalks, an online meetup where they invite folks on every month to talk about all things accessibility - one of the core components of building an inclusive web.

Outside of her mission in the technology community space, she has a deep love for mycology, geocaching, and air-cooled Volkswagens."

Host

body.value:
Static Analysis for your Drupal modules with CI
Do you read your code before running to make sure it would work? Do you see if that variable was initialized, or if you included a return statement? Do you also see if the code follows Drupal coding standard? If you answered yes to any of the above, you are statically analyzing your code in your head.

But your brain doesn’t scale, nor are you capable of checking hundreds of lines of code with every commit. Use your brain for better things and leave static analysis to tools designed for that purpose.

You might have used PAReview for your Drupal modules to verify that your code is clean and follows coding standards. It is easy to forget to run it before each commit. Do yourself and the poor soul who has to review your merge request a favor and automate!

About the speaker:
Hussain Abbas has been working with Drupal for about a decade and contributing for about 7 years. He has had the privilege of traveling to several Drupal events worldwide and speaking at almost all of them. His day job is mostly supporting his team via mentorship or management, but often gets into code writing an occasional Drupal module, developer tools, integrations, or just about anything where he can write code.

body.value:
About the Course
What is Drupal? Drupal is a popular, open source content management system. It powers websites for governments, NGOs, communities, and businesses around the world. Drupal 9, the newest version, has many exciting new features for end users, site builders, and developers.

If you're considering a platform for your next web development project, this half-day training session is a great opportunity to learn more about what Drupal has to offer.

Learning Objectives
You'll come away from this course with a knowledge of:

  • What Drupal is and why you would use it
  • Differences between websites built using Drupal vs. other platforms
  • Overview of Drupal features and when you would use them
  • How to use Drupal for a variety of websites and projects
  • How other tools can be integrated with Drupal
  • The value of the open source community

Syllabus

  • What is Drupal?
  • Debunking common myths about websites
  • What's special about Drupal?
  • What does Drupal do?
  • Introduction to Drupal modules
  • Using Drupal: admin UI, terminology, workflows
  • What can you build with Drupal?
  • Innovation by community: the Drupal way

Who Will Get the Most Out of This Course
This course is designed for project managers, decision makers, site builders and developers who are new to Drupal and want to learn the basics.

list.title: What is Drupal? An Intro to Drupal - Free Webinar

body.value: All are welcome to join us for our monthly meetup. Please RSVP using the "Agenda and RSVP" button above.

Wir freuen uns auf Teilnehmer*innen vieler Usergroups, z.B. aus Hamburg, Rostock, Berlin, Dresden, Hannover, Bochum, Köln, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Karlsruhe, Stuttgart, München oder Konstanz.

Für dieses Meetup nutzen wir wieder die Jitsi-Instanz des Drupal e.V.: https://meet.drupal.de/drupal-meetup-germany

Agenda

  • Baddy Sonja Breidert: DrupalCon Europe - Wann, Wo, Wie, Warum?
    In dieser Session werde ich über DrupalCon Europe erzählen und alle Fragen auch beantworten. Ich erwarte eine interaktive Session - also... bring Fragen mit und ich werde sie beantworten :-)
  • Daniel Speicher: Complex Data Modeling from external sources combined with Drupal Standard Modules
  • Felix Häberle: Theming des neuen Admin UI 'Claro' – Ein Erfahrungsbericht
  • Jürgen Haas: Multichannel publishing - reaching additional output channels with content segmentation and direct output and orchestration of Digital Signage devices all from within Drupal
    Kurz-Fassung meines Vortrags für die DrupalCon Europe

Die Moderation übernimmt Richard Papp.

Ein paar Tipps dazu

  • verwendet wenn möglich einen Chromium--basierten Browser (Chromium, MS Edge, Google Chrome, Vivaldi), Firefox ist bei WebRTC / Video leider problematisch
  • muted bitte euer Mikrofon, wenn Ihr den Raum betretet
  • das Betreten des Raums erzeugt eine hohe CPU-Last, also bitte nicht alle gleichzeitig Punkt 19 Uhr dazukommen
  • die Bilder vieler Teilnehmer*innen werden eingefroren sein. Das ist Absicht (Lastreduzierung)
  • vergebt beim Betreten des Raums einen Alias für euren Benutzer, damit wir euch besser erkennen können
  • nutzt den integrierten Chat in Jitsi für Infos und Fragen
  • falls Ihr Screenshots macht, informiert bitte die anderen Teilnehmer*innen vorher, damit diese ggf. ihre Kamera abschalten können (Datenschutz)

Das Online Drupal Meetup Germany bietet die Möglichkeit, sich bundesweit mit anderen Drupalistas zu treffen und auszutauschen. Jede Ausgabe wird dabei von einer anderen Usergroup betreut, welche das ist, wird beim Meetup besprochen, ebenso der nächste Termin. Themenvorschläge oder Vorträge kann dabei Jede*r einbringen!

Fragen, Wünsche oder Themenvorschläge? Schreibt einen Kommentar oder meldet euch unter https://drupalchat.me/ im Channel #drupal-meetup-germany.

Wir freuen uns auf interessante Beiträge - und auf Euch natürlich!

We are website building enthusiasts who focus on using the Drupal Content Management System (CMS) to build modern websites. We enjoy discussing web design and development topics and tackling challenges in website construction.

We discuss topics such as website building basics, user experience, web design, templating, web development, web accessibility, eCommerce, Drupal, PHP, Symphony, Composer, TWIG, YML, Linux, and much more.

We meet the first Thursday of each month starting around 6 pm. During our meetups, we discuss projects, help those with questions on getting started and usually have a presentation.

Our in-person meetups are in the conference room of the Feather Sound Panera Bread. Meetings are free if we buy food. Please tell the cashier you are with the group in the conference room. We have the room reserved only for our group from 7-8 but please feel free to come before hand to socialize and enjoy dinner

The time Schedule for our monthly meetups is:

6:00 - 7:00 | Social Hour and food*

7:00 - 8:00 | Meeting / Presentation

8:00 - 9:00 | Open Forum Discussion(s) / further chat and Q&A*
*Room is not reserved but we will be in there!

Live Captioning: Make your next event accessible for everyone

Live Captioning makes events more accessible for people with disabilities using voice to text. It helps reach an even wider audience once the event is over by providing transcripts for videos and SEO (Search Engine Optimization) value for event sites.

Voice to text technology continues to improve every year. We are now able to share our thoughts in real-time with an entire room of people using tools that capture speech into text. But did you know that live captions have benefits in addition to accessibility that allows you to reach an even wider audience?

The Live Captioning Initiative, first and foremost, helps hearing-impaired individuals follow along and participate at events in real-time. However, live captioning also benefits multicultural audiences whose first language is different from the language being spoken or comprehend written word better. It helps people understand speakers with different voices and accents in many group situations and helps make your event more accessible by enabling access for people with hidden disabilities.

About the speakers:
Andrew Olson
Qymana Botts

About the sponsor:
Kanopi Studios - They design, build and support websites for clients who want to make a positive impact.

Where: On-Line!

Join us on slack: http://sfdrupal.herokuapp.com
Subscribe to us on Youtube: https://bit.ly/SFDUG-youtube

SFDUG seeks to provide a friendly, safe environment. All participants should be able to engage in productive dialogue. They should share and learn with each other in an atmosphere of mutual respect. We require all participants adhere to the Drupal Code of Conduct. This applies to all community interaction and events.

list.title: San Francisco Drupal Users Group -  Live Captioning: Make your next event accessible for everyone

body.value:
About the Course

Drupal 9 is the culmination of the work of thousands of contributors around the globe, collaborating to create an innovative platform that's designed for everyone to use. Rather than a single cycle of new features added all at once, features have been released steadily since Drupal 8.0\. And now all those features are already tested, stable, and ready-to-use.

But you're probably wondering: what does the release of Drupal 9 mean for me?

In this webinar, we'll answer some of your biggest Drupal 9 and upgrading questions.

Learning Objectives

You'll come away from this course with a knowledge of:

  • What's the difference between Drupal 8 and Drupal 9?
  • When is the best time to upgrade?
  • How do I get started using Drupal 9?
  • Are the modules I need Drupal 9 ready?
  • If I'm using Drupal 7, should I migrate to Drupal 8 or 9?

Syllabus

  • Differences between Drupal 7, 8 and 9
  • Changes and upgrades to the Drupal 9 technology stack
  • Upgrading modules and themes for Drupal 9
  • Best practices for upgrading
  • Planning an upgrade for Drupal 7 or 8


Who Will Get the Most Out of This Course

This course is designed for project managers, decision makers, site builders and developers who are curious about Drupal 9.

Get More In-Depth Training

Evolving Web offers more advanced trainings on a variety of Drupal topics. We also offer custom courses and private trainings. Got a training request? Contact us and we'll do our best to help!

list.title: What You Need to Know About Drupal 9 - Free Webinar

body.value:
Best practices for Integrating components with Drupal

Building reusable components in a design system such as Pattern Lab is only half the job. The second half is to seamlessly integrate those components with Drupal. There are several approachs to accomplishing this in a Drupal 8 website, in this short workshop I will walk you through integrating components using the Presenter Template approach while adhering to Drupal's best practices for caching, render arrays and performance. We will make use of Twig's template suggestions, ensure our components provide mechanisms for leveraging Drupal's attributes, title_prefix, and title_suffix. By the end of this workshop, you will have a component fully integrated and rendered in Drupal with a single source of truth for markup, styles, and JavaScript, all coming from Pattern Lab.

About the speaker:
Mario is the Head of Learning at Mediacurrent with over 10 years of Drupal and Front-End experience.

About the sponsor:
Kanopi Studios - They design, build and support websites for clients who want to make a positive impact.

Where: OnLine
Join us on slack: http://sfdrupal.herokuapp.com

list.title: San Francisco Drupal Users Group - Best practices for Integrating components with Drupal

body.value:
Course Description

If you want to learn how to get started with the Drupal content management system, you'll need to understand HTML and CSS, the building blocks of web development.

The course will be hands-on, and we'll guide you through a set of exercises so you'll leave with your first Drupal website underway. You'll also learn how to find more resources online so you can expand your knowledge and take your skills to the next level.

Learning Objectives

You'll come away from this course with knowledge of:

  • Fundamentals of web development
  • Tools used to write HTML & CSS
  • How to set up, organize and edit a Drupal website using HTML & CSS
  • Hands-on experience using HTML & CSS

Syllabus

  • How are Drupal websites made?
  • HTML basics
  • Styling HTML
  • CSS basics
  • Creating a Drupal website using HTML & CSS

Who Will Get the Most Out of This Course

This course is designed for anyone curious about getting started with Drupal. No programming background is needed.

Get More In-Depth Training

Evolving Web offers more advanced trainings on a variety of Drupal topics. We also offer custom courses and private trainings. Got a training request? Contact us and we'll do our best to help!

What Our Clients Say

"Evolving Web was awesome in the HTML & CSS class. Great coverage of content done in a simple way."

— Sai Vemulakonda, Professor, George Brown College

FAQ

What do I need for this class? A laptop, headphones and a mic.

What are your other courses? Check out our full course list on our website.

list.title: HTML & CSS for Drupal - Free Webinar

body.value: All are welcome to join us for our monthly meetup. Please RSVP using the "Agenda and RSVP" button above.

Feature Discussion: Playing with WYSIWYG Inline Images

There are many different ways to allow content editors to be able to insert and manage images in the WYSIWYG. We'll take this time to explore some of the options and discuss the pros and cons of each.

Thursday, September 10. Noon to 1 pm US Central Time.

Feel free to leave comments or topic ideas in the comments.

The Zoom URL will be shared via the mailing list and the post on groups.drupal.org one day before the event.

About CIDUG Meetings

We'll be sending out notifications about this and future meetups here and via our DrupalCorn mailing list.

We meet on the 2nd Thursday of the month over the noon hour (US Central) via Zoom. There are two types of meetups: presentation and discussion. The meetup types alternate every month. Presentation meetups start with a presentation and are a maximum of 45 minutes in length. The rest of the hour is for open Q&A and discussion. Discussion meetups are like Birds of a Feather (BoF) where there may be a topic, but no formal agenda or presentation.

Sign up to present or lead a discussion.

list.title: DrupalCorn Meetup: Playing with WYSIWYG Inline Images

body.value:
Webinar Description

Discover how higher education websites succeed with Drupal! Join our webinar on Thursday, October 8, 2020 at 1 pm ET.

Drupal is often used at higher ed institutions where a common web platform is shared across a large number of sites.

This adds complexity because each site has different needs, workflows, terminology and even a different tone of voice. Individual site owners may have varying degrees of technical experiences, and getting consensus across campus is almost impossible.

In this webinar, you’ll learn 5 keys to success for implementing Drupal in higher ed, including:

  • The importance of creating reusable patterns
  • Why you should prototype before you scale up
  • How to balance flexibility with limitations
  • Content governance for content editors and site owners
  • The benefits of being involved in the open source community

Get More In-Depth Training

Evolving Web offers more advanced trainings on a variety of Drupal topics. We also offer custom courses and private trainings. Got a training request? Contact us and we'll do our best to help!

list.title: 5 Keys to Success with Drupal in Higher Ed - Free Webinar

body.value:
Taking Maximum Advantage of Drupal Core's Composer Template
If you're looking to build a modern Drupal 8 or 9 site, then you're probably going to want to use the Drupal core Composer "recommended-project" template. Debuting with Drupal 8.8, this modern, (officially) community-supported Composer template gets your project off on the right foot.

This session will both deconstruct and provide examples, tips, and tricks for making the most of the drupal/recommended-project template. We will compare and contrast it with the "Drupal Composer / Drupal Project" template, and introduce some additional dependencies to help manage your project's codebase effectively.

About the speaker:
Michael Anello (@ultimike) is co-founder and vice president of DrupalEasy, a Drupal training and consulting firm based in Central Florida. Mike has been one of the main organizers of the Florida Drupal Users' Group and Florida DrupalCamps for over ten years, is a member of the Drupal Community Working Group, and also helps manage the Drupal Association's Community Cultivation Grants program.

About the sponsor:
Kanopi Studios - They design, build and support websites for clients who want to make a positive impact.

Where: On-Line!

Join us on slack: http://sfdrupal.herokuapp.com

body.value:
Please join us for our first MidCamp 2021 planning meeting!

Why come?

Because we value giving back to the Drupal community and this is one way you can do that.

What should I expect?

That's mostly up to you -- there are a lot of roles and skillsets needed to put on a conference like MidCamp. Regardless of what you do day-to-day, you can find a fit.

What if I don't live in Chicago?

That's OK! The planning of things is done remotely. A good portion of the planning team doesn't live in or near Chicago. People join because they care about Drupal and want to help make MidCamp happen.

How to join?

We'll be using a Waiting Room for the Zoom, so please RSVP here if you plan on joining so we're able to let you in.

We are happy to announce Drupaljam will be going virtual in 2020 and that we are renaming the event to Drupaljam 2020 re:Boot. The date remains the same with Drupaljam Core Day on Friday 6 November 2020, starting at 13:00 CET. Also Contribution Day on Saturday 7 November 2020 is going to happen!

With the format changes we are happy to introduce a few new opportunities to the conference, and we strongly believe that the community will contribute to a great Drupaljam experience. The program of in depth sessions remains the same, including BoFs and keynotes. We are also looking into ways where you will be able to meet up with attendees in various formats through the platform, not only the people you already know, but those who you would have probably never met during an in-person event. Our exhibit hall will be almost the same as you would see it in live: sponsors and exhibitors will be introducing news and talk showcases in their virtual booths.

Our aim is to create a gathering that isn’t solely a broadcast of sessions, but allows for interaction, socializing and exchange of ideas and conversations. Including the Drupaljam PubQuiz which we are definitely keeping in!

Kdy: 22.9.2020 18:00

Kde: https://tinyurl.com/dcz-search

Vyhledávání patří k pokročilým požadavkům při trvorbě webu a často bývá postrachem programátorů. Navíc ho v poslední době všechny velké projekty na Drupalu vyžadují. Na tomto meetupu si přiblížíme implementaci od základního vyhledávání až k personalizaci výsleků.

Program
Vylepšujeme základní vyhledávání v Drupalu, Jan Polzer
Základní fulltextové vyhledávání v Drupalu zvládnete vylepšit o prohledávání částí slov, specifikaci jen vybraných typů obsahu či pouze konkrétních polí i bez pomoci dalších serverových technologií. Stačí modul Search API.

Personalizace obsahu s pomocí Recombee, Vít Moravský
Pohodlnou správu obsahu nám už Drupal vyřešil, ale jak nabídnout uživateli stejně pohodlně to, co ho zajímá nejvíce? Poznejte možnosti personalizační služby Recombee a sady nástrojů k její integraci do Drupalu. Jak kategorizovat a indexovat obsah, sledovat zájmy uživatele, a následně mu nabídnout co by neměl přehlédnout? Pomůžou nám s tím moduly Recombee, Search API Recombee a JSON Template.

Wir freuen uns auf die sechste Ausgabe des bundesweiten Online Drupal Meetups!

6. Online Drupal Meetup Germany
Donnerstag, 1. Oktober 2020, 19 Uhr
Organisiert von der DUG Berlin

Wir freuen uns auf Teilnehmer*innen vieler Usergroups, z.B. aus Hamburg, Rostock, Berlin, Dresden, Hannover, Bochum, Köln, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Karlsruhe, Stuttgart, München oder Konstanz.

Für dieses Meetup nutzen wir wieder die Jitsi-Instanz des Drupal e.V.: https://meet.drupal.de/drupal-meetup-germany

Die DUG Berlin hat wieder spannende Themen gesammelt, unter anderem von:

  • Norman Kämper-Leymann (@leymannx) - Drupal Diversity und was Du tun kannst um die Community inklusiver zu machen
  • Boris Böhne (@drubb) - Flexible Drupal Testinstanzen mit Gitpod
  • Yannick Leyendecker (@yannickoo) - Storybook & Chromatic

Ein paar Tipps dazu:

  • verwendet wenn möglich einen Chromium--basierten Browser (Chromium, MS Edge, Google Chrome, Vivaldi), Firefox ist bei WebRTC / Video leider problematisch
  • muted bitte euer Mikrofon, wenn Ihr den Raum betretet
  • das Betreten des Raums erzeugt eine hohe CPU-Last, also bitte nicht alle gleichzeitig Punkt 19 Uhr dazukommen
  • die Bilder vieler Teilnehmer*innen werden eingefroren sein. Das ist Absicht (Lastreduzierung)
  • vergebt beim Betreten des Raums einen Alias für euren Benutzer, damit wir euch besser erkennen können
  • nutzt den integrierten Chat in Jitsi für Infos und Fragen
  • falls Ihr Screenshots macht, informiert bitte die anderen Teilnehmer*innen vorher, damit diese ggf. ihre Kamera abschalten können (Datenschutz)

Das Online Drupal Meetup Germany bietet die Möglichkeit, sich bundesweit mit anderen Drupalistas zu treffen und auszutauschen. Jede Ausgabe wird dabei von einer anderen Usergroup betreut, welche das ist, wird beim Meetup besprochen, ebenso der nächste Termin. Themenvorschläge oder Vorträge kann dabei Jede*r einbringen!

Fragen, Wünsche oder Themenvorschläge? Schreibt einen Kommentar oder meldet euch unter https://drupalchat.me/ im Channel #drupal-meetup-germany.

Wir freuen uns auf interessante Beiträge - und auf Euch natürlich!

Do you miss the community? We do too!

What do you need?
- internet connection
- good mood
- good drink

What we talked about in the past?
- life
- automation of home and of deployments
- changes in Czech Drupal Association

Unless someone objects, we usually talk in Czech and in Slovak.

Stream link will be posted later.

DrupalCamp er en event som samler Drupal-interesserte fra Norge og resten av verden for å lære, dele og bli inspirert om Drupal spesifikt, og web generelt. En dag full av foredrag og faglige diskusjoner der man deler kompetanse og erfaring, og en samarbeids-sprint på søndag. Programmerere, designere, webutviklere, webredaktører, markedsførere - alle vil kunne finne noe av interesse.

DrupalCamp is an event that gathers Drupal enthusiasts from Norway and the rest of the world to learn, share, and be inspired about Drupal specifically, and the web in general. A day full of talks and technical discussions where people can share their skills and experience, and a cooperative sprint on Sunday. Programmers, designers, web developers, web editors, marketers - everyone will be able to find something of interest.

Mediepartner/Media partner: The Weekly Drop

list.title: DrupalCamp Oslo 2020 (også på nett / also online)

body.value:
Join the San Francisco Drupal User Group (SFDUG) to network, co-work and socialize with fellow Drupal users.

General Agenda:
* 5:30 - 6:00 pm: Networking and socializing (Sponsor - Kanopi Studios)
* 6:00 - 6:15 pm: “Your Dose of Drupal Dialogue”
— Discussion on what’s in Drupal news
— Who is hiring in the SF Bay Area? Who needs to hire?
* 6:15 - 7:15 pm: Presentation: Solr in Drupal 8/9: a real live example with Karim Boudjema
* 7:15 - 7:30 pm: Wrap up, more hanging out and chatting up Drupal

Solr in Drupal 8/9: a real live example
In this session we will talk about how we used Apache Solr as a search and views backend in a real live example: videodrupal.org, a new community website with more than 6000 drupal videos that aims to be a central point to quickly find Drupal videos and help new comers or advanced Drupal users to learn Drupal smoothly and effortlessly.

About the speaker:
Karim Boudjema has been a Drupal backend developer for more than 10 years.
Most of his work has been focused on the media industry, he's developed large Drupal websites such as major newspapers sites or marketplaces with hundreds of thousands of nodes and millions of visitors each month.

About the sponsor:
Kanopi Studios - They design, build and support websites for clients who want to make a positive impact.

Where: OnLine
Join us on slack: http://sfdrupal.herokuapp.com

SFDUG seeks to provide a friendly, safe environment. All participants should be able to engage in productive dialogue. They should share and learn with each other in an atmosphere of mutual respect. We require all participants adhere to the Drupal Code of Conduct. This applies to all community interaction and events.
